dialogue_history.content:
Analyze this financial news and estimate stock price movement probabilities.
Company: Apple Inc. (AAPL)
News Headline: Futures higher, Trump's tariff threats, Apple earnings - what's moving markets
News Content: Investing.com - U.S. stock futures pointed higher on Friday, with investors pouring through fresh tariff threats from U.S. President Donald Trump and a raft of tech earnings, including iPhone-maker Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL). Meanwhile, a key gauge of inflation that is closely followed by the Federal Reserve is scheduled to be released, with markets trying to determine the possible path ahead for central bank's monetary policy this year.

1. Futures higher

U.S. stock futures inched higher on Friday, as traders assessed renewed tariff threats from U.S. President Donald Trump and parsed through a batch of earnings from major technology companies.

By 03:39 ET (08:39 GMT), the Dow futures contract had ticked up by 88 points or 0.2%, S&P futures had risen by 23 points or 0.4%, and Nasdaq 100 futures had advanced by 155 points or 0.7%.

The main averages on Wall Street climbed in the prior session despite equities paring back some earlier gains following fresh tariff comments from U.S. President Donald Trump (more below). An upbeat outlook from electric vehicle giant Tesla (NASDAQ:TSLA) helped to offset software titan Microsoft's (NASDAQ:MSFT) disappointing guidance for its all-important cloud computing unit.

Investors were also mulling over statements from executives at Microsoft and Facebook-owner Meta Platforms (NASDAQ:META) about the emergence of a low-cost artificial intelligence model from Chinese start-up DeepSeek, which roiled global stock markets earlier this week.

2. Trump's fresh tariff threats

Trump has told reporters he would follow through on an earlier threat to slap 25% import tariffs on Canada and Mexico on February 1, arguing that the move was designed to stem the flows of illegal migrants and fentanyl into the U.S.

He also suggested that he was still planning to place additional levies on China, although he did not provide more details.

In a later post on Truth Social, Trump warned members of the so-called BRICS group of countries -- Brazil, Russia, India, China and South Africa -- that they could face 100% duties if they attempt to replace the U.S. dollar as a reserve currency, reiterating a prior threat made in late November.

Markets have been on edge in recent days as Trump weighs his tariff options.

Although he has so far opted not to impose universal levies since his return to the White House, he has threatened actions against specific economies. Some economists have flagged that the tariffs could refuel inflationary pressures in the U.S. and spark a broader trade war -- increasing uncertainty for both businesses and investors.

Story Continues

3. Apple's iPhone outlook

Shares in Apple were higher in extended hours trading, rebounding from an initial dip following the iPhone maker's latest quarterly results.

Executives at the company said the group now expects sales to grow in the low- to mid-single digits in its fiscal second quarter. The guidance surpassed expectations and pointed to momentum in demand for the iPhone, Reuters reported, citing analysts.

The rosier outlook helped to assuage some worries around sales for Apple's flagship handset, which dropped marginally and missed estimates in its key holiday shopping quarter, due in part to the firm's new AI features not being available in some markets. Still, CEO Tim Cook said the enhancements, known as Apple Intelligence, are boosting sales.

Apple has taken a more cautious approach to AI compared to its Silicon Valley peers, choosing not to spend heavily on building out data centers. The strategy seemed to help insulate the stock during the DeepSeek-inspired market turmoil earlier this week, which led to steep drops in other Big Tech shares.

4. PCE ahead

The release of the December personal consumption expenditures price index is due to highlight the economic calendar on Friday.

Economists predict the inflation metric will come in at an annualized pace of 2.6% and 0.3% month-on-month, both faster than previous readings of 2.4% and 0.1%.

The "core" measure, meanwhile, is seen at 2.8% year-on-year, matching November's rate, and edging up to 0.2% from 0.1% on a monthly basis.

Policymakers at the Federal Reserve will likely be assessing the figures as they attempt to gauge the future path of inflation in the world's largest economy. On Wednesday, the Fed left interest rates unchanged at a range of 4.25% to 4.5% and signaled that they would take a wait-and-see attitude to potentially slashing borrowing costs this year, with officials noting lingering uncertainties around the broader economic outlook.

5. Crude set for weekly losses; gold near record peak

Oil prices edged higher Friday, but were set for weekly losses as traders fretted over the prospect of trade tariffs under President Trump.

By 03:40 ET, the US crude futures (WTI) gained 0.2% to $72.88 a barrel, while the Brent contract rose 0.1% to $75.99 a barrel.

For the week, Brent is set to fall 1.6% while WTI has declined 1.8%. However, for the month of January, Brent is set to gain around 3%, its best month since June, and WTI is poised to climb 2.1%.

Elsewhere, gold prices hovered around a record peak as investors eyed Trump's tariff comments and cautiously awaited the upcoming U.S. inflation report.

Related Articles

Futures higher, Trump's tariff threats, Apple earnings - what's moving markets

Euro zone consumers, forecasters see higher inflation despite ECB optimism

German unemployment rate rises with economic malaise

View Comments

Next I will provide you some predictions of stock price movement probabilities and the corresponding analysis by others in the previous rounds.
Note that others' predictions may indicate that they have some other information about the stock price. A high prediction may indicate that they have some positive information about the stock, while a low prediction may indicate that they have some megative information about the stock.
Also note that there are multiple rounds of precitions, demonstrating the trend of others' beliefs.
Please take these information into consideration when prediction the stock price movement probabilities.
Previous predictions:
Round: 0
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.65, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.35, Reasoning: The news indicates a mixed outlook for Apple, with positive earnings guidance boosting investor sentiment, while external factors like Trump's tariff threats create uncertainty. The strong earnings outlook suggests a likelihood of stock price increase, but ongoing tariff concerns could dampen enthusiasm. Given the recent trends in stock futures and Apple's response to recent market turmoil, I estimate a higher probability of stock price rise than fall.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.65, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.35, Reasoning: The news presents a mixed bag for Apple (AAPL). Futures are up, indicating positive market sentiment. Apple's earnings guidance exceeded expectations, which is a strong positive signal, further boosted by CEO's comments on Apple Intelligence. However, Trump's tariff threats cast a shadow of uncertainty over the entire market and could negatively impact Apple. Additionally, a potentially higher PCE could lead to uncertainty over the Fed's actions. Weighing the positive earnings guidance against the external economic uncertainties and potential down-side from tariffs necessitates considering a mixed probability.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.65, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.35, Reasoning: The news presents a mixed outlook for Apple. While the overall market futures are positive, Trump's tariff threats introduce significant uncertainty.  Apple's earnings report, however, is generally positive, exceeding expectations and suggesting continued iPhone demand.  The improved outlook for Apple's second quarter and its relatively cautious approach to AI, which insulated them during recent market turbulence, are positive factors.  The upcoming inflation report might affect the overall market and thus indirectly impact Apple, but the immediate impact of the earnings report seems more significant. Weighing these factors, the positive news from Apple's earnings announcement likely outweighs the general market uncertainty caused by Trump's threats, suggesting a higher probability of price increase.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.7, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.3, Reasoning: The news highlights several factors influencing Apple Inc.'s stock price. On the positive side, Apple's earnings report showed a rebound in extended hours trading, with executives providing a rosier outlook for sales growth in the fiscal second quarter, surpassing expectations. This is likely to boost investor confidence. Additionally, Apple's cautious approach to AI has insulated it from market turmoil affecting other Big Tech stocks. On the negative side, broader market concerns include Trump's tariff threats, which could lead to inflationary pressures and trade wars, creating uncertainty. However, the immediate impact of Apple's positive earnings and outlook seems to outweigh these broader concerns. The upcoming PCE data could also influence the market, but its direct impact on Apple is less clear.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.6, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.4, Reasoning: The news article discusses several factors that could impact Apple's stock price. On the positive side, Apple's iPhone outlook for the fiscal second quarter was better than expected, with executives predicting sales growth in the low- to mid-single digits. This guidance surpassed expectations and indicated momentum in demand for the iPhone. Additionally, CEO Tim Cook mentioned that Apple Intelligence features are boosting sales. On the negative side, the article mentions renewed tariff threats from President Trump, which could lead to increased uncertainty and potentially impact Apple's supply chain and profitability. However, the overall market sentiment seems to be cautiously optimistic, with US stock futures inching higher. Considering these factors, I estimate the probability of Apple's stock price rising as 0.6 and the probability of it falling as 0.4.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.65, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.35, Reasoning: The news article discusses various market-moving factors, including Trump's tariff threats, Apple's earnings, and the upcoming release of the personal consumption expenditures price index. Apple's earnings surpassed expectations, with the company expecting sales to grow in the low- to mid-single digits in its fiscal second quarter. This positive outlook, combined with the overall market trend of futures pointing higher, suggests a favorable environment for Apple's stock price. However, the uncertainty surrounding Trump's tariff threats and potential inflationary pressures could introduce volatility. Given the positive earnings report and the market's initial reaction, the probability of the stock price rising is higher than the probability of it falling.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.6, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.4, Reasoning: The financial news indicates mixed signals for the tech sector as a whole, with Apple's specific guidance surpassing expectations for the next quarter and the stock reacting positively. While market concerns over potential tariffs from Trump could cause some volatility, the core message around Apple's iPhone business shows positive trends. The PCE data is expected to show inflation rising but remains within a predicted range, and oil prices are stable but trending downwards. These factors combined suggest a bullish outlook for Apple based on their earning results.


Now give your prediction about the probability of the stock price of the relevant company rising or falling. Format your response in JSON format and include the following information as follows: 
{ 
"reasoning": "[Summarize your analysis and reasoning process here]", 
"company_name": "[Company Name indicating the name of the company]", 
"company_symbol": "[Company Symbol indicating the stock symbol of the company]", 
"news_headline": "[News Headline indicating the provided financial news headline]", 
"probability_of_stock_price_rise": [The estimated probability (a number between 0 and 1) that the stock price will rise due to this news], 
"probability_of_stock_price_fall": [The estimated probability (a number between 0 and 1) that the stock price will fall due to this news], 
}

```
{
  "reasoning": "The news presents a mixed outlook for Apple Inc. (AAPL). On the positive side, Apple's earnings guidance for the fiscal second quarter surpassed expectations, with executives predicting sales growth in the low- to mid-single digits. This positive outlook, combined with the overall market trend of futures pointing higher, suggests a favorable environment for Apple's stock price. Additionally, Apple's cautious approach to AI has insulated it from market turmoil affecting other Big Tech stocks. However, there are negative factors such as Trump's renewed tariff threats, which could lead to inflationary pressures and trade wars, creating uncertainty. The upcoming PCE data could also influence the market, but its direct impact on Apple is less clear. Considering these factors, the positive earnings report and market reaction suggest a slightly higher probability of the stock price rising than falling.",
  "company_name": "Apple Inc.",
  "company_symbol": "AAPL",
  "news_headline": "Futures higher, Trump's tariff threats, Apple earnings - what's moving markets",
```
